build-type.name: D3.Deploy NIF
build-type.description: Create a new docker image for the application neocom-infinity-nest

parameters.param:
# D E P L O Y K U B E R N E T E S # Deploy the image to the Kubernetes namespace # # - variables required to be on the environment. # APP_CODE - the reduced application string like 'neonest'. # ENV - the selector between a deployment and a production release # NAMESPACE - the destination Kubernetes namespace. # PORT - the standard service port of the application under the declared service. Ir is static for an application. # EXPOSE_PORT - the port number exposed to the localhost. It should change depending on the ENV. # VERSION - the image version that is assigned to the pod. # MODULE_NAME - the infinity module name. It is the long directory name of the software module. # IMAGE_TAG - the Dicker repository image tag name. Usually the module+version.
# - environment definition to be mapped on kubernetes maps # NODE_ENV - the angular environment selected. # PORT - already declared. # ENVIRONMENT - possible to be deprecated because values are duplicated. # NODE_VERSION - the Node version being used on the pod. # PRODUCTION - undefined its purpose. To be deprecated. # SEMVERSION - semantic version. Included the number of commits from last deployment version. # VERSION - already declared. # ESI_CLIENTID - ESI unique client identifier for the application OAuth installation. # ESI_STATE - the unique state identifier to validated the callback to the correct application and initiator. # CALLBACK_URL - the URL to be used for callback on the authorization flow. # ESIPROXY - host for ESI requests. # OAUTHPROXY - host for ESI OAuth authorizartion flow. # PUBLICPROXY - host for public ESI data request. # BACKENDPROXY - host for the NeoCom backend. Applies to the SpringBoot services. # NESTPROXY - host for the NeoCom backend. Applies to the NestJS services. # APP_CODE - already declared. # MODULE_NAME - already declared. # APP_HOME - the directory location where the client code is located for local service. # APP_BASEREF - the relative path to the application code.
# - set environment values export APP_CODE=%APP_CODE% export ENV=%env.ENV% export NAMESPACE="neocom-$ENV" export PORT=%PORT% export EXPOSE_PORT=%env.EXPOSE_PORT% export VERSION=%env.VERSION% export MODULE_NAME=%PROJECT_NAME% export IMAGE_TAG=%env.IMAGE_NAME%:%env.VERSION%
export PROJECT_ROOT=%teamcity.build.checkoutDir%/%PROJECT_NAME% cd $PROJECT_ROOT export NODE_ENV=$ENV . .env.$NODE_ENV echo ">>> ENVIRONMENT" export NAMESPACE=neocom-$NODE_ENV printenv | sort echo "<<<<<"
# - Generate kubernetes deployment file from template export DEPLOY_DIR=%teamcity.build.checkoutDir%/%PROJECT_NAME%/.deploy cat $DEPLOY_DIR/deployment.template.yaml | envsubst > $DEPLOY_DIR/deployment.yaml echo ">>> DEPLOYMENT" cat $DEPLOY_DIR/deployment.yaml echo "<<<<<"
kubectl apply -f $DEPLOY_DIR/deployment.yaml
